item.title: [HBASE-11137] Add mapred.TableSnapshotInputFormat
item.description: We should have feature parity between mapreduce and mapred implementations. This is important for Hive.

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.

comments.comment:
Attaching patch for trunk. Will post on RB once it's back up. Starting on a backport for 0.98. stack: you want this for 0.96 as well?

This patch extracts implementation into TableSnapshotInputFormatBase. mapred and mapreduce implementations delegate functions to that implementation. Test is similarly structured. One big difference I noticed is that mapred does not support providing a Scan for limiting the data processed by mappers. For this reason, mapred.TestTableSnapshotInputFormat tests deviate slightly from the base. That functionality should be added in a followup ticket.

ping Enis Soztutar, Lars Hofhansl, stack, Andrew Purtell.

Though adjacent, I think these failures are unrelated. Reattaching for rerun.

There's now a patch demonstration how this might be used on HIVE-6584. We really need to support specifying a Scan for mapred jobs; most of the mess in HiveHBaseTableInputFormat is for circumventing this limitation.

Here's a patch for 0.98, based on the trunk v01. I repeated the refactor manually, no fancy git-rebase, so please give it the same scrutiny you'll give the trunk patch. Both have been verified using IntegrationTestTableSnapshotInputFormat running on my local sandbox with numRegions=15 (this is a magic number that works with and without HBASE-9445, according to Enis Soztutar).
I've put patch v01 up on RB: https://reviews.apache.org/r/21461/

Forwarding my +1 from RB.

Did you figure out how Hive does filter pushdown without scan support in mapred?

Forwarding my +1 from RB.

Thanks Enis Soztutar. Replied on RB as well (I'm not receiving notification email for some reason).

In addition, I'll s/TableSnapshotInputFormatBase/TableSnapshotInputFormatImpl/ so use as a delegate (instead of a base-class) isn't confused.

Did you figure out how Hive does filter pushdown without scan support in mapred?

Yes, I looked into that. Hive works around the lack of feature by consuming our internal API, mapreduce.TableInputFormatBase. I opened HBASE-11163 and HIVE-7058 to get them back onto our public APIs on all fronts.
Attaching what was committed.
